text: Beacon's price target on $VRNOF of $34 C is Bonkers. The company's mgt, its advisors and common sense should bring the analyst back to reality. @realmoney @dougkass @todd_harrison

This is a 40% decline in AGP's price target for $VRNOF. As I tweeted out earlier in the week, finally estimates and price targets are no longer fanciful for cannabis stocks. I and others were early but now is the time to accumulate - when analysts acknowledge. @realmoney

I wanted to leave you all with this thought. There are very few fundamental investors that appear in the business media these days. Almost all worship at the altar of price momentum - even though they might wear a fundamental disguise. They are no different than the quants -

"buyers higher and sellers lower." This exaggerates moves up and down. Their narratives and commentary shift with the weather. Learn to manage your short term/trading money with this in mind! It helps to explain why I average into positions @realmoney @threadreaderapp unroll

Up on @realmoney @seabreezelp @DougKass Aug 16, 2022 | 10:20 AM EDT DOUG KASS The Bear Market Case: Why We May Now Be Approaching Another Important Top in the U.S. Stock Market * The markets have rallied robustly since the June market low.

* To a large degree the rally has been position driven - as the hedge fund community and others derisked and degrossed * As the momentum in stock prices began to improve, market structure and the role of passive investing products and strategies - who worship at the altar of

price momentum - reversed from sellers to buyers. * But the fundamental backdrop is arguably deteriorating. * And valuations are not very compelling at a time in which the Federal Reserve is caught in a policy box given the toxic cocktail of likely sticky inflation and slowing

domestic/global economic growth. * Most investors find it hard to move outside the herd - it might again be time to be a contrarian. * I have avoided the bearish consensus in June and plan to avoid the growing optimism in late August. "There are decades where nothing happens;

and there are weeks where decades happen." - Vladimir Ilyich Lenin realmoney.thestreet.com/doug… @jimcramer @tomkeene @ferrotv @lisaabramowicz1 @carlquintanilla @RiskReversal @gnoble79 @ScottWapnerCNBC @SaraEisen @threadreaderapp unroll

@todd_harrison I also wanted to ask $VRNOF management: Second with regard to your capital allocation comments earlier - specifically that you and others continue to face some headwinds to growth in Florida and elsewhere.
At what point does it make sense to repurchase stock vs. continuing your aggressive strategy of inorganic expansion? Would you raise capital at current share price levels to fund more growth?
Basically I am asking what is the best path that you see to maximize shareholder value at Verrano? @threadreaderapp unroll
Todd You are an advisor to $VRNNOF You should tell tham all calls from shareholders should be entertained in a conference call. @todd_harrison
Well I guess they didnt answer all of the calls!

@todd_harrison I dont know if $VRNOF conf call is open to questions. I would love this question/comment to be addressed but I dont know how to communicate it in a listen only format, maybe you can help... "I have been on literally thousands of conference calls over my career.

Typically the Q and A consists of specific and more granular company questions My question is different - it addresses what cannabis investors have been going thru over the last few years. Specifically I would be interested in your personal view of why cannabis stocks in

general and your company's shares in particular have been so weak over the last several years. Has it been unrealistic fundamental expectations? Has it been concerns regarding the size of the total addressable market that you face? Has it been by the slow roll out of states
and/or the lack of progress regarding federal legislative intiatives? Second, with regard to your capital allocation comments and some of the state expansion headwinds... .

At what point does it make sense to repurchase stock vs.initiating more aggressive inorganic expansion thru acquisitons." Please explain, thanks. Doug Kass Seabreeze Partners PS Thanks for your help, Toddo! @threadreaderapp unroll

I have expanded my cannabis holdings on the recent dive. My point is that the twitter threads and bullish pablam over the last few years on the subject of cannabis investing have had been repetitive and have held little value for investors. It is the definition of insanity to

tweet out the same thing while the total addressable market potential has proven illusive, fundies deteriorate, prospects for state roll outs and federal legislation is diminished and the long term projections for sales/cf/profits continue to be unrealistic.

If I was tweeting out the pablam I would stop and reassess and start to tweet out reality rather than fantasy so expectations can be readjusted. Frankly I am embarrassed for those that continue to tweet out "pie in the sky" optimism without a sense of current reality.
I have admitted to mistakenly buying cannabis stocks earlier and others should be as honest with themselves and their twitter followers. @threadreaderapp unroll
2 years, not 22 years!
Respectfully...

The bulls, wrong about every signficant factor that influences cannabis stocks for 22 years - continue with the same pablam (some of which is conflicted by advisory roles, dogma and dreams). Time to stop retweeting nonsense and explain why things will change from down to up...

The definition of insanity is doing the same thing over and over again - and expecting a different result. I have watched the cannabis optimism for the last years as the group is basically the worst sector performer. All assumptions were wrong - size of TAM, fundies, legislation
